I originally started playing on console when this game first came out back in 2016. I switched to PC around Ana's release and played ranked OW (Diamond Support main) nearly everyday until the release of Ash, by which point I started playing other games and wasn't as dedicated to OW. By this point I'd only play during the seasonal/story events. I almost quit playing entirely once OW2 was announced and the devs left OW1 in limbo for three years. I didn't stop playing because I didn't like the game; I still found it fun from time to time. But the extremely toxic community and lack of meaningful content and updates had me looking to other games to scratch my competitive itch.

Overwatch 2 was supposed to revitalize both the game and the community. Blizzard promised us a brand-new expansive PvE experience and a revamped PvP. Instead, we got a half-baked balance update (the only real meaningful change was the removal of one tank role), three new heroes, and a few new maps. What has Blizzard been doing the entire time while they left OW1 to wither and rot? 

Blizzard decided to make OW2 free-to-play and it's just as you would expect it to be: grindy battle passes with sub-par items that no one cares for, an overpriced premium shop to spend $20+ on skins, and a slow drip-feed of content to keep gamers coming back to spend more money. I am *not* a fan of battle passes. I don't want to feel obligated to dedicate hours of my life grinding a game for fear of missing out on items that I payed for. I hate having to do challenges that forces me to play content I never cared to do in the first place; playing roles I don't like, playing game modes I don't want to play. And then there's the shop. I wouldn't mind the shop if the items were reasonably priced, but I'm not paying over $20 for a single skin for a character in a game where swapping heroes mid-match is needed and encouraged. The worst part about this isn't even the pricing, either. It's the fact that you can no longer *earn* the new cosmetics anymore. Say what you will about loot boxes in gaming, Blizzard actually did it right with OW1. You earn loot boxes every time you level up. And if you wanted more loot boxes, you can just buy them. You didn't need to buy boxes if you didn't want to. I never spent a dime on them. Everything I had pre-OW2 I had earned. Now if you want any cosmetics, you *have* to buy them, either through the shop or the battle pass. 

Ranked OW2 is a literal crapshoot. Blizzard decided to hide everyone's SR and now you can't see if you move up or down in ranking. A reasonable person would assume,"I won a match, I must be going up in rank" but no. That's not how it works. You can win 7 matches in a row and when the game decides to update your rank, you'll find yourself in a lower division.Your placement matches mean nothing. It doesn't matter how high you were in OW1 or how well you performed in your placements. Most players end up somewhere between silver-gold and will have to work their way up to their proper rank. This issue is made even worse by the fact that OW2 is F2P. Now there's an endless stream of smurfs and hackers in the lower divisions. If you're the type to solo-queue, you're going to have to claw your way tooth and nail through teammates below your skill level, GM smurfs, and aimbotters. 

I've never felt so betrayed by a game company before. I've dedicated years of my life to this IP. And what do I get in return? Empty promises and a slap to the face by greedy suits that don't care nor respect the players. They ruined a beloved IP with so much potential just for some quick profit. 

Now the only thing Overwatch is good for is being source material for r34 artists and animators.

Fuck Bobby Kotick and fuck Blizzard.

tf2

Overwatch was, easily, one of the best games to come out in its time, a game that could rival TF2, where anyone could pick up and play any hero and find the playstyle that works best for them.

This is NOT that game.

OW2 is, at best, a lazy cash-grab. The game locked and locks mountains of content behind paywalls and battle passes, making it essentially pay to win. One of the core game modes was basically thrown out because it was "too hard to balance", the PvE mode was scrapped and unscrapped over and over until now a handful of missions exist for a separate cost, when they were supposed to be free (and the entire reason for the game existing in the first place). This game is a sad husk of what the original was.

Also, notice how they only ever announce that a character is part of some marginalized group (Usually LGBTQ+) when they're back in hot water for something *really* bad.

If you want to play an ACTUAL good hero shooter, play TF2, play Paladins, play ANYTHING else, this game will make you want to put a drill to your brain.
